content.p: Wodka is the implementation of a genetic algorithm for breeding soda robots. It is designed as platform that allows configuration of the genetic algorithm in an easy and flexible way.
The idea is that wodka provides the infrastructure that is needed to breed soda robots, to allow you focusing on your ideas without having to think about technical details.

ul.li: Interface for implementing different genetic representations (genotypes) of soda robots.
Interface for implementing different selection strategies.
Java class representation of soda models.
Racer classes for easily testing models on the soda race application.
Persistence layer for saving and reloading the genetic algorithm at any state of evaluation.
Export functionality to generate race xml's for the soda race application that illustrate the evolution of your models.
Parameterization of all attributes by means of a parameterization interface.

Distributed evaluation, by means of vgrid

content.p: Wodka is a java application.To run it you need the java virtual machine on your computer. If you have a Mac you are lucky as it is already installed. The others can get it from java.com for free.
You need version 1.4 or higher.
Test it by typing in a commandline window (console) 'java -version'. The result should be something like 'java version 1.5.0_02 Java (TM) 2 RuntimeEnvironment...'
You can start the wodka breeder directly by klicking the following links:
Download the the latest wodka release from the wodka download page .The name is wodka vx.x (e.g. wodka v0.22).
One release consists usually of a single zip file that contains executables, libraries and source code.

ul.li: Expand the downloaded zip file anywhere on your computer. E.g. to 'c:\Program Files' or '/usr/local/'

If you run wodka under linux you will have to generate your own script files to start wodka. Take the .bat files in the /bin/ directory as a template. As wodka uses a java invoker the changes should be minimal.

content.p: Whenever you start any of the wodka applications the first time a wodka directory is generated in your user home directory. Within the wodka directory an admin directory is created that holds a wodka.properties fle. This file will be the main source for configuration for all wodka applications in the future. Detailed infos about the properties can be found in the properties file itself.
To breed your own soda models you you have to start the wodka breeder. You may do this by starting the /bin/breeder.bat file or by using java webstart.
Click the [i] button to show the details of the current genetic algorithm.
Click [new] to generate a new genetic algorithm.
You can configure the following components

ul.li: Genotype: The genetic representation of your models.
Selection Policy: The way how individuals for a new generation are selected.
Racer: The program that runs races between the geneticaly generated models to measure their fitness.
Terrain: A terrain for whitch the models should be optimized. There are also some socalled incremental terrains. They get more and more hilly as the models master the race in a certain time.

content.p: After you have generated a genetic algorithm you may save ([save] button) it in order to load the set of attributes at a later time.
Next push the [start] button to begin the breeding process. After about 50 generations you should get some moving models.
If you have any problems please refer to the wodka help forum.
The geno lab application gives you an idea what random models will (can) be generated for the diffrent genotypes. Start geno lab by clicking /lib/genolab.bat or by using webstart
The wodka batch program is a breeder without GUI. You can use it to breed models systematically. E.g. for a scientific project. If you want to use wodka batch refer to the help forum.
The wodka zoo builder prepares the batch results to inspect them. If you want to use it pease ask at the help forum.
